title: Drawing, "Design for a Centerpiece", 1630–60
medium: Black and white chalk on tan laid paper
markings:
Watermark: foolscap upper 1/2 of sheet; below: a cross upon three circles (see card for more details)
Recto: Stamp in black ink: Museum for the Arts of Decoration the Cooper Union Museum [Lugt 457c]
inscribed:
Recto: across bottom of sheet in graphite: Cornelius de Cock 10 Drawings Presented by Ogden Codman Esq. 1916 (7)
verso in brown ink: "Twapon hobb inde gouar/ vylbusse/ gelegt dot hyr / toobehoort." (See card for more details.)
description: Four intertwined tails of dolphins support four shells. Putti holding reeds sit upon the dolphin’s heads. Another child bearing a trident stands upon the shells, above.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for a Centerpiece", 1630–60.
1630–60. Black and white chalk on tan laid paper. Gift of Ogden Codman. 1916-9-9.
